title: Night in the Square
provenance_text:
Kumi Sugaï [1919-1996], Paris, France [1]; Galerie Craven, Paris, France [2]; acquired by Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1955 [3].

Notes:
[1]. The Japanese artist Sugai lived and worked in Paris for many years.
[2]. The painting was lent by Galerie Craven to "The 1955 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Painting" held at Carnegie Institute, October-December 1955 (no.285; illustrated, plate 107.) 
[3]. The painting was given to the museum as a gift from the 1955 International by G. David Thompson [1899-1965], Pittsburgh, PA. According to the minutes of the Fine Arts Committee meeting of October 12, 1955, Mr. Thompson had arranged an exchange from his private collection for three of the paintings from the International that he had offered to the museum, including this work.
